casebody.data:
Robert B. RAGLAND, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. John A. VOLPE, as Secretary of Transportation, and Francis C. Turner, as Federal Highway Administrator, Defendants-Appellees. No. 71-2464. United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. March 30, 1972. Rehearing Denied April 26, 1972. William H. Maness, Jacksonville, Fla., for plaintiff-appellant. John L. Briggs, U. S. Atty., John D. Roberts, Asst. U. S. Atty., Jacksonville, Fla., for defendants-appellees.

Before TUTTLE, GEWIN and THORNBERRY, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM:

The judgment of the trial court is affirmed for lack of standing of the plaintiff. See Barlow v. Collins, 397 U.S. 159, 90 S.Ct. 832, 25 L.Ed.2d 192 (1970); Association of Data Processing Service Organizations, Inc. v. Camp, 397 U.S. 150, 90 S.Ct. 827, 25 L.Ed.2d 184 (1970).
